title: Jackson returns in style as Ravens rout Dolphins
content: After starting 1-5, the Ravens have won two straight and Lamar Jackson has them in position for a possible run.

title: Woodward out as LSU AD amid Landry's criticism
content: Scott Woodward is out as LSU's athletic director, the school announced Thursday night, with the ouster coming in the wake of Gov. Jeff Landry's criticism of him earlier this week.

title: Lamar return has Ravens feeling 'dangerous' again
content: After missing three games because of a right hamstring injury, Ravens QB Lamar Jackson threw four touchdown passes in a 28-6 victory over the Dolphins on Thursday night.

title: Wemby leads Spurs to franchise's first 5-0 start
content: San Antonio, behind star Victor Wembanyama, is off to its hottest start in its 50 seasons in the NBA.

title: Sources: WNBA, players extend CBA for 30 days
content: The WNBA and WNBPA agreed Thursday to a 30-day extension of the current collective bargaining agreement through Nov. 30, sources confirmed.

title: Jeered in Miami, McDaniel shares fans' frustrations
content: Plagued by "self-inflicted wounds," the Dolphins fell to 2-7 after a sloppy 28-6 home loss to the Ravens in which they were loudly booed by fans throughout.

title: Sources: NBA, books review most vulnerable bets
content: The NBA and its partner sportsbook have had ongoing discussions on what types of bets are most vulnerable to manipulation and what betting limits are appropriate for such bets, sources told ESPN.

title: Ohtani roles for potential G7 include opener, OF
content: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts will consider using Shohei Ohtani as an opener or even as an outfielder in a potential Game 7 against the Blue Jays.

title: Jackson prevails in HBCU coaching clash vs. Vick
content: DeSean Jackson's Delaware State team defeated Michael Vick's Norfolk State 27-20 in a historic matchup of HBCU coaches.

title: WNBA, union agree to CBA extension -- what's next in negotiations?
content: The league and WNBPA agreed to a 30-day extension of the current CBA. How did we get here and what happens next?

title: Which NFL teams should make trades before the deadline? Barnwell sizes up expectations for all 32
content: Could the Lions add help? Will the Jets trade stars? Should the Giants make any moves? Let's look at which teams might swing deadline deals.

title: What we're hearing about the open Power 4 college football jobs and what comes next
content: Coaching changes are happening fast. With a month left in the season, here are six things to monitor.

title: With Rhule, Cignetti off the list, who are the top candidates for Penn State
content: Penn State is looking for a new coach, but lost two targets. It's still one of the best in the cycle.

title: The comprehensive guide to the women's hoops season, including preseason picks
content: Who's winning the 2026 national title (UConn? UCLA? South Carolina? LSU?) and other preseason picks, predictions.

title: Storylines to watch in all 31 men's basketball conferences
content: Will UConn or St. John's win the Big East? Here are questions that could shape every league in 2025-26.

title: 'I didn't even know he was a gambler': How the Blazers and NBA are grappling with Chauncey Billups' stunning downfall
content: The questions inside the Blazers' locker room and across the NBA are the same: How do we reconcile the man we thought we knew -- and a man the federal government believes is a criminal?

title: Timeline of past century's major pro sports gambling scandals
content: A history of the consequences when players, coaches and referees cross the line into the betting world.

title: 'We've got to figure something out': Dodgers must start hitting -- or this World Series is over
content: A lineup full of All-Stars has looked off all postseason long -- and especially in the Fall Classic. Can L.A. fix it before it's too late?

title: Sources: Feds eye MLBPA venture over spending
content: Players Way was cited in an anonymous whistleblower complaint last November that triggered an ongoing criminal investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office in Brooklyn.

title: Week 10 preview: Why Georgia's matchup with Florida just means more, plus key matchups
content: Key matchups and the story behind why Georgia quarterback Gunner Stockton really wants a win against Florida.

title: How Vanderbilt has gone from SEC doormat to CFP contender
content: After years of being a punching bag, coach Clark Lea and the 7-1 Commodores are showing plenty of fight.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 9
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Playoff push: Trade targets and what to expect from murky RB rotations
content: What to make of backfield rotations, players on the rise and who to target as we approach the fantasy playoffs.

title: Inside Marcus Kowal's fight to change America's drunken driving laws
content: Marcus Kowal, an ex-MMA fighter, wants to change American drunken driving laws after the tragic death of his 15-month-old son.

title: The next generation of entertainers: 15 young stars lighting up Europe
content: Bill Connelly shines a spotlight on 15 under-21 players who have begun to make a name for themselves on Europe's biggest stages.

title: Lakers' Jake LaRavia turns Anthony Edwards' question into a caption
content: Anthony Edwards' courtside commentary and Jake LaRavia's 27-point night turned a shorthanded matchup into an instant classic.

title: NBA Cup: Let's project group favorites and the teams fighting for a wild-card spot
content: The third edition of the in-season tournament tips off on Friday. Let's take a look at who has the best chance to advance to Vegas in December.

title: Nebraska's black alternate uniforms headline best Week 10 threads in CFB
content: The Cornhuskers are going with an all-black look for their prime-time matchup with USC on Saturday night.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Two win streaks on the line at UFC Fight Night
content: One fighter's unbeaten streak will come to an end when David Onama and Steve Garcia clash at UFC Fight Night. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid edge Liverpool in Guéhi race
content: Real Madrid are leading the chase over Liverpool to sign Marc Guéhi from Crystal Palace in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: What we've learned: Arsenal's struggles; Spurs' defense impresses
content: The Women's Super League is through six games this season and returns after international break. But what have we learned so far?

title: Survivor pool strategy: Rams, Chargers among top options in Week 9
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 9, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: 'Toughest player I've ever seen': The Legend of Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Giannis is a one-man show this season
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from Giannis Antetokounmpo, Nikola Jokic and other notables around the NBA this season.

title: Rs 2cr dues, moral demands: What triggered Rohit Aarrya’s hostage act in Mumbai - timeline of events
content: A social entrepreneur, Rohit Aarrya, held 17 children and others hostage in a Mumbai studio after feeling betrayed by the government over his civic initiative. The standoff ended in a police shootout, with Aarrya dead and the hostages rescued. His actions stemmed from a perceived lack of accountability and stolen ideas.

title: Another Sheesh Mahal? BJP claims Kejriwal has 'luxurious 7-star mansion' in Punjab
content: AAP MP Swati Maliwal has accused Arvind Kejriwal of using Punjab government resources for personal luxury, alleging he has been allotted a "luxurious 7-star, two-acre government bungalow" in Chandigarh. She further claimed he used a government helicopter and private jet for party work, stating the entire Punjab government is serving him.

title: 'Within hours, she stopped breathing': MP infant dies after taking ayurvedic cough syrup
content: A heartbreaking incident unfolds in Chhindwara as a five-month-old baby tragically passes away after reportedly ingesting a contaminated ayurvedic cough syrup. This grim event adds to the distressing tally of over 24 child fatalities linked to a dangerous cough syrup. In response, the local pharmacy has been shut down, and authorities are launching a thorough investigation.

title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs: CEO Andy Jassy breaks silence; what he said
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy revealed that the recent layoff of 14,000 employees isn't due to financial woes or AI, but rather a cultural shift. He explained that rapid growth led to increased layers and diluted ownership, slowing down operations. This contrasts with other executive statements emphasizing AI's transformative role and the need for leaner structures.

title: Defying Trump's US manufacturing push? Ford returns to India with Rs 3,250 cr plan
content: Ford Motor Company is set to restart manufacturing in India. The automaker will invest Rs 3,250 crore in its Chennai facility. This move marks a significant return after exiting vehicle production in 2021. The plant will focus on engine manufacturing for export. Production is scheduled to begin in 2029. This project is expected to create over 600 jobs.

title: Dump it, face it: Bengaluru civic body dumps garbage back at litterbugs’ doorsteps
content: Bengaluru's 'Kasa Suriyuva Habba' anti-littering campaign booked 218 cases and collected Rs 2.8 lakh in fines on its launch day. The initiative aims to enforce cleanliness through penalties, with marshals monitoring and recording violations to deter public dumping and promote waste segregation.

title: Punjab: 3 SFJ operatives arrested for writing pro-Khalistan graffiti on schools’ walls
content: Authorities have apprehended three individuals linked to the banned Sikhs for Justice group for allegedly painting pro-Khalistan slogans on school walls in Punjab. Police investigations suggest these acts were funded from abroad and aimed at inciting unrest. The swift action by Counter Intelligence and local police underscores a commitment to national security and peace within the state.

title: China sales slip for Apple: Supply disruption cited; CEO Tim Cook expects recovery soon
content: Apple's China sales dipped unexpectedly, but not due to waning demand. Supply chain issues were cited as the primary reason. CEO Tim Cook expressed optimism, highlighting strong store traffic and positive reception for the new iPhone 17 series.  He anticipates a return to growth in China, with global sales projected to rise significantly.

title: India win Women's World Cup? INDW beat SA by 100 runs, claims internet's 'encyclopedia'
content: Wikipedia users discovered a premature posting of the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final result, showing India defeating South Africa by 100 runs, despite the match being scheduled for Sunday. The fabricated scores contained mathematical errors, highlighting Wikipedia's open editing policy. Editors are expected to rectify such unauthorised modifications promptly.

title: ‘Didn't see them as enemies’: Why Indian team shook hands with Pak players
content: Indian junior hockey players defied political tensions by sharing high-fives with their Pakistani counterparts after a draw, showcasing true sportsmanship. This gesture contrasted with the cricket team's stance, highlighting a different approach to rivalry. Both players are now set to compete in the Hockey India League, aiming to further develop their skills.

title: How to watch interstellar comet 3I ATLAS passing through the solar system
content: A rare interstellar visitor, comet 3I/ATLAS, is currently traversing our solar system, offering scientists a unique chance to study an object from another star.  This comet, unlike those orbiting our Sun, follows a one-time hyperbolic path.  Best viewing opportunities are in the eastern predawn sky mid-to-late November 2025, requiring at least an eight-inch telescope.

title: Jio partners with Google: Offers free Gemini Pro AI model worth Rs 35,100; how to claim
content: Reliance Jio is offering its subscribers 18 months of free access to Google's Gemini 2.5 AI Pro model, a significant move to democratize AI in India. This collaboration aims to empower citizens and businesses with advanced AI tools, following similar initiatives by competitors. The offer is initially available to Jio users aged 18-25 via the MyJio app.

title: Mumbai shocker: Doctor stabbed by hospital staffer’s kin over ‘affair’; 2 arrested
content: A 26-year-old doctor at KEM Hospital was allegedly attacked and stabbed by the brother and friends of a female hospital staff member over their alleged relationship. Two individuals, Farid Khan and Nabeel Khan, have been arrested for assault and attempt to murder. The doctor sustained minor injuries and is out of danger.

title: ‘It was raining ...’: Cong recalls Indira’s 1977 Bihar visit; posts pics of her on elephant
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh commemorated Indira Gandhi's 41st death anniversary, highlighting her "uncommon grit, courage, perseverance, and resilience." He recalled her 1977 visit to Belchhi, Bihar, where she rode an elephant to meet victims of caste atrocities, a journey seen as a political revival. Other Congress leaders also paid tribute, remembering her as the "Iron Lady of India."

title: Delhi doctors reconstruct 20-year-old’s thumb; use toe from amputated leg
content: In a remarkable feat of medical innovation, doctors in New Delhi have successfully reconstructed a young accident victim's thumb using his own second toe. The patient, who lost his leg and thumb in a severe road accident, underwent a complex microsurgical procedure.

title: 42-year-old chef diagnosed with breast cancer after ignoring this key symptom
content: A 42-year-old chef's battle with aggressive male breast cancer, a rare but serious condition, underscores the importance of vigilance. Despite initial dismissal of a chest lump, his diagnosis highlights that men are not immune. Early detection is crucial, as symptoms like lumps or nipple changes can be easily overlooked.

title: 'New chapter': Rajnath meets Hegseth amid US tariff row; 10yr defence framework signed
content: India and the US have signed a landmark ten-year Defence Framework Agreement, marking a new era of defense cooperation. The pact, inked by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth, outlines a roadmap for enhanced military collaboration and joint initiatives across the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Gold price today: What is the gold rate today? Check cost of 24K, 22K gold in your city
content: Gold prices experienced a dip in domestic futures trade on Friday, influenced by the Federal Reserve's stance on interest rate cuts and a temporary truce in US-China relations. Despite this, global gold prices saw a slight increase. The article also provides a city-wise breakdown of gold rates for both 24K and 22K purity.

title: 'Resilience, belief and passion' - Kohli hails India's historic chase vs Australia
content: India's women's cricket team achieved a historic feat, stunning defending champions Australia to reach the World Cup final. Jemimah Rodrigues' unbeaten 127 led a record chase of 339, securing a five-wicket victory. Virat Kohli lauded the team's grit and belief, highlighting Rodrigues' standout performance in a remarkable display of resilience and passion.

title: Trump-Putin meet cancelled: Russia blames ‘maximalist demands’
content: A planned summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Budapest has been called off. This follows Moscow's submission of "maximalist" demands for ending the Ukraine war, including significant concessions on sanctions and territorial claims. US officials reportedly cancelled the meeting after reviewing these conditions, a stark contrast to earlier optimism about their personal chemistry.

title: World’s first white Iberian lynx captured on camera in Spain’s wild mountains
content: A rare white Iberian lynx, believed to be the first leucistic of its kind, has been spotted in Spain, a testament to successful conservation efforts.  This pale feline, a symbol of nature's resilience, highlights the remarkable comeback of the species from near extinction. Its sighting underscores the importance of ongoing protection for this vulnerable predator.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for today? Why ‘buy on dips’ makes sense
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to trade within a defined range with a neutral outlook, according to LKP Securities. Analysts suggest a 'buy on dips' strategy for investors, targeting specific price levels.  The market is currently consolidating, awaiting key economic data and US dollar movements for direction.

title: Man with air gun shot in chest: How Mumbai’s tense hostage drama unfolded; cops reveal details
content: A tense hostage situation in Mumbai concluded with the captor, Rohit Aarrya, dead after firing at police. Aarrya held 17 children and two others at a recording studio for nearly two hours. Negotiations failed, and police claim they returned fire in self-defense after Aarrya shot first. The incident stemmed from a past dispute over project dues.

title: 'Objected to relationship': Girl, her friends, strangle mother in Bengaluru
content: A teenager and her friends allegedly murdered her mother and staged it as a suicide in Bengaluru. The 17-year-old daughter, after initially fleeing, confessed to the crime after her aunt alerted the police. The motive stemmed from the mother's disapproval of her daughter's relationship.

title: 3I/ATLAS may be the oldest comet ever seen in 7 billion years
content: Astronomers have identified 3I/ATLAS, an ancient, ice-rich interstellar comet potentially older than our solar system. Discovered by the University of Oxford, its origin in the Milky Way's thick disk offers a unique glimpse into early galactic processes. Scientists anticipate studying its composition as it nears the Sun, providing vital clues about the formation of stars and planetary systems.

title: Rashtriya Ekta Diwas: PM Modi pays tribute to Sardar Patel — Watch video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi honored Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel at the Statue of Unity on 'Rashtriya Ekta Diwas'. The PM offered prayers and floral tributes, emphasizing Patel's pivotal role in India's integration and his enduring legacy of national integrity. A video highlighting Patel's life and achievements was also shared by the Prime Minister

title: How India celebrated the emotional World Cup win in dressing room; Jemimah gets hugs
content: Jemimah Rodrigues' unbeaten 127 powered India to a historic World Cup final, overcoming personal anxiety and past setbacks.  Despite battling mental health struggles, she displayed immense resilience, crediting divine intervention and unwavering support for her match-winning performance against formidable Australia.  Her journey highlights triumph over adversity.

title: Lenskart IPO opens today: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, price band & more
content: Eyewear giant Lenskart is launching its IPO on Friday, aiming to raise Rs 2,150 crore to fund store expansion, technology, and marketing. With a price band of Rs 382-Rs 402, analysts recommend subscribing for the long term, citing its strong business model and market leadership. The company's robust financial growth and international expansion plans are key highlights.

title: 'Final day for audition': How Rohit Aarrya pulled off Mumbai hostage siege; his warning to cops
content: A social entrepreneur held 17 children, an elderly woman, and a staffer hostage for three hours at a Mumbai recording studio. After failed negotiations, police stormed the studio, shooting the captor in self-defense when he fired an air gun. The man, who claimed he wanted to be heard, was declared dead at the hospital.

title: Mahima Chaudhry & Sanjay Mishra’s wedding pics go viral — here’s the real truth
content: Photos of Mahima Chaudhry and Sanjay Mishra in wedding attire went viral, leading many to believe they had tied the knot. However, the images are a promotional stunt for their upcoming film, 'Durlabh Prasad Ki Doosri Shadi'. The movie's makers released the visuals as part of the film's marketing campaign.

title: Did Erika Kirk reject Taylor Swift’s $60M offer for All-American Halftime Show?
content: A viral social media post falsely claimed Taylor Swift offered Erika Kirk sixty million dollars to perform at a Turning Point USA event. Fact-checking reveals no evidence of this offer. The story gained traction online, fueling political debates. Turning Point USA announced its own faith-based halftime show. This incident highlights how misinformation spreads rapidly online.

title: Women's WC: 'One more game to go' - Harmanpreet keeps focus on final
content: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed immense pride after her team reached the Women's ODI World Cup final with a historic five-wicket victory over Australia.  A record 339-run chase, powered by Kaur's 89 and Jemimah Rodrigues' 127, secured their spot. Kaur emphasised the team's focus remains on winning the final, highlighting lessons learned from earlier close matches.

title: 'Money pouring into US': Trump hails tariffs; reveals 'one question that kept coming up'
content: President Trump declared his Southeast Asia trip a resounding success, citing "great deals" and renewed global respect for America. He highlighted a breakthrough with China, easing tariffs and resuming soybean trade. Trump also criticized Democrats, accusing them of seeking to divert healthcare funds to undocumented immigrants and urged Republicans to abolish the filibuster.

title: Shah says Rahul’s 'maternal roots' in Italy; accuses him of 'insulting' Chhath
content: Union home minister Amit Shah criticized Rahul Gandhi for allegedly insulting Chhath Puja, attributing it to his "maternal home" in Italy and ignorance of Indian culture.

title: 'No 3s being No 1s': Jemimah revives Gambhir’s 2011 heroics
content: Jemimah Rodrigues delivered a match-winning unbeaten 127, drawing comparisons to Gautam Gambhir's 2011 World Cup final knock. Her brilliant century anchored India's record-breaking 339-run chase against Australia, propelling them into the ICC Women's World Cup final.  Rodrigues' composed performance, alongside Harmanpreet Kaur's 89, secured a historic five-wicket victory.

title: 'I was crying every day': Jemimah breaks down; reveals battle with anxiety
content: Jemimah Rodrigues, India's World Cup hero, emotionally revealed her battle with anxiety and self-doubt after her match-winning century against Australia.  She shared how family, friends, and faith helped her overcome a difficult tournament start, leading to a historic win and a place in the final. Her courage in vulnerability resonated deeply.

title: Hack of the day: Set app time limits to stop endless scrolling
content: Regain control of your screen time with a simple hack. Major social media apps like Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube offer built-in time limit features. This guide provides step-by-step instructions to set daily limits, helping you stay focused and manage your device usage effectively.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex below 84,400
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Friday on mixed global cues. While Nifty50 was near 25,850, BSE Sensex was below 84,400.

title: Sushant’s sister claims psychics told her he was ‘murdered by two people'
content: Late actor Sushant Singh Rajput’s sister, Shweta Singh Kirti, has reignited conversations surrounding her brother’s tragic death with startling revelations. Speaking in a recent interview, she claimed that two psychics — one based in the United States and another in Mumbai — told her that Sushant was “murdered by two people” and did not die by suicide.

title: 'Been there six times': How Nasa dismissed Kim Kardashian’s moon-landing doubts - Watch
content: NASA has firmly refuted reality star Kim Kardashian's claims questioning the 1969 moon landing.  Acting administrator Sean Duffy clarified that animations, not actual footage, were misinterpreted by broadcasters.  NASA confirmed that astronauts indeed walked on the moon, having successfully completed six missions to its surface.

title: How Epstein ties led to Prince Andrew's ouster; what's next for him?
content: King Charles III has stripped Prince Andrew of his royal title and ordered him to leave his Windsor residence, Royal Lodge. This drastic action follows intense public pressure and scrutiny over his association with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.  Andrew, who denies allegations of sexual assault, will relocate to a property on the King's Sandringham estate.

title: Tyreek Hill’s season over? Check details on his injury & future with Dolphins
content: Miami Dolphins' star receiver Tyreek Hill faces a season-ending knee injury, potentially sidelining him until 2026.  Torn ligaments require surgery, casting doubt on his future with the team.  League sources suggest Miami might release him due to his contract and ongoing domestic violence allegations.  Hill's recovery and NFL standing are now uncertain.

title: NDA’s manifesto ‘string of lies’; released in just ‘26 seconds’: Congress leader Ashok Gehlot
content: Congress leader Ashok Gehlot criticises NDA’s 26-second manifesto launch, calling it a “string of lies” and questioning leadership transparency

title: Manuel Frederick, hockey player and Kerala’s first Olympic medallist, passes away
content: Manuel Frederick played for the Indian team for seven years, was honoured with the Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award in 2019 for his contributions to sports

title: Kerala CM showcases ‘extreme poverty eradication’ as crowning point of LDF government
content: In a statement on the eve of 69th Kerala Formation Day on November 1, Pinarayi Vijayan portrays the project to identify and eradicate extreme poverty as a ‘people’s movement’

title: Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences: Born out of a crisis, built to redefine care
content: Conceived in the shadow of COVID-19, the Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences (TIMS) was envisioned as a long-term response to the vulnerabilities that the pandemic exposed in the public healthcare system. Now nearing completion, the ₹1,070-crore, 1,000-bed TIMS facility at Sanathnagar in Hyderabad represents the State’s biggest leap toward an autonomous, next-gen government hospital model. As its opening draws near, Siddharth Kumar Singh examines whether it would live up to that promise or end up as a missed opportunity

title: 16 students injured in temporary gallery collapse in private college in Kerala
content: Gallery collapsed at Kottayam college during a programme for Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel’s birth anniversary. The injured included NCC and NSS students

title: ‘Will prove our innocence’: T.N. Minister Nehru on ED’s claim of malpractices in his department
content: “The State police will scrutinise the documents and determine if any irregularities occurred. I have done nothing wrong,” he said

title: Five sentenced to death for murdering Chittoor mayor Katari Anuradha, husband
content: The court found all five accused guilty of murder and criminal conspiracy, and sentenced them to death

title: Ex-BJP MLA’s son assaults toll staff in Vijayapura in Karnataka, video goes viral, no case booked yet
content: A video clip of ex-BJP MLA Vijugouda Patil’s son and his aides allegedly assaulting toll booth staff in Vijayapura district has gone viral on social media

title: Vice Admiral Sameer Saxena assumes charge as Flag Officer Commanding-in-Chief of Southern Naval Command
content: Vice Admiral Saxena, who was commissioned into Indian Navy on July 1, 1989 and is a specialist in navigation and direction, succeeds Vice Admiral V. Srinivas

title: Three terror suspects held in Rajasthan
content: Rajasthan’s Anti-Terrorism Squad detains three terror suspects during ongoing raids in Jodhpur and Jaisalmer

title: TMC leader flays bills to remove PM, CM detained for 30 days, says they undermine presumption of innocence
content: The TMC Rajya Sabha leader said the Bills claim to promote accountability, but on close inspection, they undermine the presumption of innocence.

title: Supreme Court asks Bar Council of India to notify polls for Punjab, Haryana bar councils; directs polls by December 31
content: Senior advocate Narender Hooda submitted that as per rules, the current body of Bar Council of India cannot continue beyond the tenure of seven years

title: CBI team visits Karur stampede site
content: The team, led by Praveen Kumar, Superintendent of Police, studied the topography of the area and the surrounding approach roads, including the spot where Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam president Vijay addressed massive crowds from his caravan

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin slams PM Modi’s remarks during Bihar election campaign
content: Mr. Stalin shared a video clip in which Mr. Modi was heard alleging that DMK members in Tamil Nadu were harming people from Bihar

title: Ford announces plan to revive Chennai plant with ₹3,250-crore investment
content: Representatives from Ford and the Tamil Nadu government signed a MoU with a focus on producing all-new, next-generation engines.

title: Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues shines as India beat Australia to reach World Cup final
content: Her composed knock helped India chase down 339 — the highest in Women’s ODI history — and secure a place in the November 2 final against South Africa. The innings has been hailed as a defining moment in Indian women’s cricket.

title: Lawyers cannot be summoned by probe agencies for their legal advice to clients: SC judgment
content: A Bench of Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and K. Vinod Chandran said advocates could be summoned by the agencies only in exceptional situations enumerated in Section 132 of the Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam, 2023 (BSA)

title: Curriculum on AI to be introduced in all schools from Class 3 onwards: MoE
content: AI and Computational Thinking curriculum to start in all schools from Grade 3, enhancing future-ready education by 2026-27.

title: Kolluru disaster response team rescues shepherd, 90 sheep from rising Krishna river
content: “Officials said the timely coordination between the community and the mandal emergency team exemplified the effectiveness of the district’s preparedness,” SDRF officials said

title: ‘Dies Irae’ movie review: Rahul Sadasivan delivers one of the finest horror films in Malayalam
content: In ‘Dies Irae’ starring Pranav Mohanlal, director Rahul Sadasivan crafts a chilling horror experience that transforms everyday moments into sources of dread, further proving his greatness in the genre

title: MEIL Energy acquires 250 MW power plant in Tamil Nadu
content: “Our focus remains on expanding our footprint across the energy sector through strategic investments that enhance national energy security, ensure reliable supply, and support India’s long-term growth,” MEIL Group CFO, Salil Kumar Mishra said

title: MLC Beeda Ravi Chandra serves defamation notice on Y.S. Bharati Reddy
content: Mr. Ravi Chandra called the reports that appeared in the Sakshi media as biased, partial and prejudiced

title: Bangladeshi man jailed for 8 years in rape case; two more get 5 years over illegal stay in India
content: According to the prosecution, Joshim Sobur Mulla (26) was accused of raping two minor girls trafficked from Bangladesh. Acting on a tip-off by an NGO, the police had rescued the survivors in 2017

title: Montha cyclone: Jagan Mohan Reddy’s comments ridiculous, says Yanamala Ramakrishnudu
content: “Jagan Mohan Reddy is caught in his own political calamity of losing out badly to the Telugu Desam Party-Jana Sena Party-BJP alliance in the 2024 elections,” Yanamala said

title: One crore jobs for youth, free education, and infra growth: NDA releases Bihar polls manifesto
content: The NDA, if voted to power, will also set up a world-class medicity, one medical college in each district, free ration, free treatment worth ₹5 lakh and 50 lakh more pucca houses, according to the 69-page manifesto

title: India, U.S. ink 10-year defence framework pact
content: As Rajnath Singh meets his American counterpart Peter Hegseth, the Defense Minister says the pact will provide policy direction in the entire spectrum of the India-U.S. defence relationship

title: After 265 days, Kerala ASHA workers to end strike in front of Secretariat
content: Though the women health workers are ending their agitation in front of Secretariat in Kerala capital, they will continue their protest at the district level

title: Savita Samaj stages protest in Kalaburagi against derogatory remark by BJP MLC C.T. Ravi
content: Protesters led by Savita Samaj district president Anand Warik accused the BJP leader of using a prohibited and offensive term while referring to their community

title: Delhi riots case hearing highlights: Seriousness of offence not a factor when bail sought for prolonged incarceration, petitioners tell SC
content: Delhi High Court on September 2 denied bail to nine people, including Khalid and Imam, saying “conspiratorial” violence under the garb of demonstrations or protests by citizens could not be allowed

title: VTU opens Centre of Excellence in AI, digital classrooms and library in Kalaburagi
content: The inauguration of these KKRDB-funded facilities marks a major milestone in VTU’s efforts to advance digital learning, promote skill-based education, and strengthen research in emerging technologies across the Kalyana Karnataka region

title: ‘Drone tech can help contain crop loss, promote biodiversity and soil health’
content: V. P. Chaudhary Principal Scientist, ICAR-Central Institute of Agricultural Engineering, Bhopal, spoke on the various aspects of drone application in agriculture at a workshop in UAS-Dharwad

title: 22-year-old criminal shot dead in northeast Delhi's Seelampur
content: The incident took place around 10.40 pm on October 30 when a firing was reported. On reaching the spot, police found a man with gunshot injuries lying near Jama Masjid in the area, they said

title: Jinnah, Savarkar behind India’s partition; BJP now dividing neighbourhoods: Digvijaya Singh
content: Digvijay Singh also said that ‘proofs of citizenship’ are being collected under the guise of the Special Intensive Revision of voter lists in the country.

title: PM Modi fulfilled Sardar Patel’s dream of unified India by abrogating Article 370: Amit Shah
content: Because of Article 370, J&K was not fully integrated into India so PM Modi accomplished the work of Sardar Patel by abrogating the Article and now we have ‘Akhand Bharat’ with us, Mr. Shah said

title: Rashtriya Ekta Diwas: PM Modi says Sardar Patel wanted to unite entire Kashmir with India, Nehru did not allow it
content: The birth anniversary of Patel is being celebrated as Rashtriya Ekta Diwas (National Unity Day) on October 31 since 2014, when Mr. Modi became the Prime Minister for the first time

title: Watch | DMK vs. Election Commission: The SIR controversy in Tamil Nadu
content: The DMK and its allies have come out in the open questioning the Election Commission of India’s move to roll out the Special Intensive Revision in Tamil Nadu. We take a look at the controversy

title: Waste treatment factory to resume operations
content: The permission was granted by the committee chaired by District Collector Snehil Kumar Singh after reviewing the field-level inspection reports submitted by the Kerala State Pollution Control Board and the Suchitwa Mission

title: India faces GDP loss of up to 24.7% by 2070 due to climate change: EU official
content: Our private sector brings cutting-edge technologies and expertise in solar, wind, bioenergy, storage, and green hydrogen, while Indian enterprises contribute scale and dynamism, says Dr. Philipp Ackermann, Ambassador of Germany to India

title: Ernakulam DDMA plans measures to prevent student drowning incidents
content: Despite awareness campaigns, the number of drowning deaths keeps increasing. They happen because of carelessness, says an official of District Disaster Management Authority

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: NDA releases manifesto, promises 1 crore government jobs, free education and infrastructure growth
content: Seven expressways, 10 industrial parks, four new metros and ₹2000 financial aid per month for SC students pursuing higher education are some of the other features of the manifesto

title: Traffic chaos reigns as elevated corridor works on Paradise-Dairy Farm stretch begins
content: Motorists reported delays between 10 minutes to over 30 minutes on the adjoining internal roads due to the road closure and diversions

title: Indian-origin man fatally attacked after confronting stranger urinating on his car in Canada
content: The victim, identified as Arvi Singh Sagoo, succumbed to his injuries five days later, the Edmonton Police Service said in a statement

title: Cyclone Montha | Ministers Ponnam, Tummala assure relief to farmers who suffered crop loss
content: Centre should declare damage caused by unprecedented rainfall in Telangana a natural calamity and extend help to mitigate woes of rain-affected people, says Ponnam Prabhakar

title: Karnataka jealous of Andhra Pradesh’s rise, says BJP leader
content: “The Congress cannot digest India’s growth. The comments made by Karnataka Minister M.B. Patil shows their frustration and jealousy,” said Sadineni Yamini Sarma

title: Karnataka to seek ₹1,545 crore from Centre from NDRF for losses during Southwest Monsoon
content: Though the actual damage of infrastructure is more than ₹ 5,000 crores in Karnataka, we have sought ₹ 1,545 crores as per the NDRF norms: H.K. Patil

title: Mamata urges people not to get provoked by SIR, says no legitimate citizen will be left out
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister who had dubbed the SIR as National Register of Citizens through back door, reiterated that her government “will not allow NRC to be implemented in Bengal — neither through the front door, nor through the back door”

title: The internal rewiring of a grand old party: Congress focuses on DCCs for revival
content: As part of its newly launched leadership selection programme, Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan, the Congress is banking on empowered district-level leadership. After extensive screening and consultations, the 139-year-old party will appoint District Congress Committee presidents through a merit-based process across States. Sandeep Phukan explores the process and the criticism

title: Government relaxes green cover norms for industrial projects
content: Against a 33% green cover mandated earlier, industrial estates can earmark 10% for plantation while individual industries can have 15% greenbelt in their respective project areas

title: Chargesheet submitted in gang-rape of medical college student in West Bengal’s Durgapur
content: The chargesheet comes after 20 days of the horrific crime; charges have been pressed against the six accused for rape, gangrape, extortion, dacoity among other sections of BNS

title: India firmly believes in rule of Law of the Sea, says DMK MP
content: Thamizhachi Thangapandian introduces Prof. Bimal N. Patel, India’s candidate for the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea (ITLOS) in New York

title: Cyprus ready to be part of IMEC: Foreign Minister Kombos
content: Constantinos Kombos said that the Cyprus-India ties are not aimed at “counterbalancing” any regional power and stand on their own “merit”

title: Quack arrested near Arani who offered medical treatment for nearly a decade
content: The quack offered medical treatment to patients in the village for nearly a decade without professional qualification

title: Fisherfolk in Machilipatnam reel under livelihood loss due to cyclone
content: Many fisherfolk have been out of work for the past one week as warning came right after Deepavali, forcing them to borrow money from boat owners to run their families, forcing them deeper into the debt trap

title: A call for sustainability in space science
content: Minoo Rathnasabapathy, from the MIT Media Lab and a leading voice in responsible space systems, said that in order to achieve space sustainability, emerging nations must have access to available data

title: IIT-Madras researchers achieve ‘soft landing’ for vertical take-off aircraft and UAVs
content: Combining real-time hybrid rocket thruster with a virtual simulation, the researchers “achieved the necessary velocity for soft landing, a crucial feature for all craft ranging from planetary landing of unmanned or manned exploration module to terrestrial landing of a VTOL (vertical take-off and landing) aircraft”.

title: How Kerala eradicated extreme poverty
content: On November 1, the Kerala government is set to declare the State extreme poverty-free, the culmination of a four-year-long strenuous exercise. Four lakh enumerators fanned out across the State and identified the most marginalised. The local bodies then devised micro-plans to suit each family. The government claims that the programme uplifted 1,03,099 people from extreme poverty. S.R. Praveen interacts with some of the beneficiaries and also listens to dissenting voices

title: Sengottaiyan meets expelled AIADMK leaders Panneerselvam, Dhinakaran, Sasikala
content: Palaniswami accuses Sengottaiyan of working against the AIADMK for long, and vows action against him. He holds him responsible for the party’s defeat in Anthiyur in the 2021 Assembly election

title: Devanathan Yadav now says he requires six more months to mobilise ₹100 crore
content: The accused in the Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund Nidhi scam informs the Madras High Court that he could not raise the money as most of the documents related to the immovable properties are with the police

title: Allahabad High Court cites ‘defect’ in probe, commutes death sentence of four in CRPF camp attack case
content: The court said that the “prosecution miserably failed to prove the case against the accused for the principal offence beyond reasonable doubt”

title: Social and Educational Survey: Can register online till Nov. 10
content: Though the survey was supposed to have been completed by October 7, it was extended twice since the progress had been slow in the initial days

title: Sardar Patel’s vision and the meaning of national unity today
content: Unity, Patel taught us, is a task renewed in every generation. It must be defended against the fragmenting impulses of indifference, ignorance and regionalism

title: NIA seeks more details from U.S. on Tahawwur Rana in 26/11 Mumbai attacks case
content: Following a court order in June, the agency has submitted a compliance report under Section 207 of the Criminal Procedure Code about the supply of documents linked to the previous chargesheet filed in 2011.

title: Closed, duplicate entries push GBA’s survey completion in Bengaluru above 100%
content: The survey is set to conclude on October 31, with online extension open for voluntary participation until November 10

title: ‘Caste-neutral’ women voters may rally behind Nitish
content: Will the Nitish Kumar government’s decision to hand over ₹10,000 to 1.2 crore women, timed for the elections, prove to be a game changer?

title: Congress demands SIT, judicial probe into Maharashtra woman doctor’s death
content: The party said that the incident exposed the “mentality” of the BJP and the RSS “towards the deprived and women” and added that the doctor had been fighting political pressure from a former BJP MP

title: Over 50 residents held for opposing allocation of land to displaced people
content: A resident says the govt. land should be used to improve infrastructure facilities such as schools, health centres that will benefit the villagers

title: Annual parade to mark Sardar Patel’s birth anniversary from this year: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will take the salute of the grand parade to be held at Ekta Nagar in Gujarat

title: India ready to help Afghanistan build hydroelectric facilities: MEA
content: Cooperation to build hydel power projects was part of a joint statement issued during a visit by the Taliban’s Acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi on October 10

title: Government will introduce new Seeds Act soon, says Agriculture Minister
content: Both the UPA and NDA governments were unsuccessful in amending the Seeds Act in the past due to opposition from farmers’ organisations

title: How No. 11 Trinity Jones adds to a growing Clemson class; more girls' commit fits
content: there are 17 five-star recruits in the girls' SC Next 100 class of 2026 as of mid-october . the latest commitment comes from no. 11 Trinity Jones . we can make some informed projections . what's next for those programs that have signed these top-tier talents?

title: Ranking the top 50 NHL prospects: Who follows Schaefer, Demidov?
content: the Islanders lead the list with five in my top 50, followed by the blackhawks, sharks and mammoth with four apiece . no. 1 draft pick Matthew Schaefer is the only defenseman in NHL history to record a point in his first five games .

title: Class rankings: Texas Tech climbs; fallout from firings continues
content: the player rankings update helped classes at Texas Tech, Indiana and Minnesota climb . the bigger picture to watch is how the slew of current and potential job openings will impact the class rankings . classes at Florida and LSU bring a great deal of intrigue as they are ranked inside the top 15 .

title: 'Kept shouting, banging on door': Noida women stuck for an hour inside sauna
content: Advitya Bahl is a crime reporter with the Times of India's Noida edition.  With nearly a decade of experience covering both high and medium level criminal cases, court trials, and police investigations, he has built sources within the beat with reputation, integrity, and impactful storytelling. Advitya's  work sheds light on systemic flaws in law enforcement and brings voices to the fore. Read More

title: Pushed to the periphery, Nwaneri seizes his chance to shine for Arsenal
content: Ethan Nwaneri is still only 18 and has had to wait for a moment like this . the 18-year-old was one of arsenal's breakthrough stars of last season . but fortunes have conspired to complicate his continued involvement in the first team .

title: 'Are you ready to go all-in?' Inside the talks on Logan Cooley's $80M Mammoth contract
content: Logan Cooley was eligible for an extension this summer . the 21-year-old was fixated on eight years, the max they could offer . he is 21 years old, and it's the biggest decision he's made in his entire life, not even close .

title: Alimony from 1st marriage not enough, court upholds maintenance for woman
content: Jaideep Deogharia is an Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with 21-year career experience in print media preceded by two years stint in electronic media. After leading the Jharkhand bureau for 7 years, he is now reporting from the ground in Delhi NCR, covering courts including National Green Tribunal, consumer rights, environment, and climate change. He specializes climate change, human rights and left-wing extremism and is a trained expert mediator. An IVLP alumnus of 2024, he enjoys music badminton and traveling in leisure. Read More

title: How Trey Yesavage met the moment and pushed the Dodgers to the brink
content: Trey Yesavage hits out 12 in a showtopping performance for the blue Jays vs. the Dodgers . the 22-year-old right-handed rookie was under attack during game 5 of the world series . his first game this season came in April for Single-A Dunedin .

title: What Aidan Hutchinson's extension means, and which pass rushers are getting paid next
content: aidan Hutchinson has been a star for the team from day one . he finished second in the 2022 draft with a team-leading 9.5 sacks and a pro Bowl nod . the move means the franchise will have its best pass rusher for years to come .

title: Projecting Jai Lucas' first top commitment as Miami head coach, more recruit fits
content: there are currently 19 five-stars atop the SC Next 100 player rankings for the men's college basketball class of 2026 . six are off the board, with Miami getting its first top commitment of the Jai Lucas era in no. 16 Caleb Gaskins .

title: NFL Week 9 arrivals, featuring Dolphins' Aaron Brewer's Michael Myers mask
content: week 9 of the season marks another opportunity for players to make the most of their fits . the calendar entered the first week of November, but that didn't put an end to summer weather fits, or mark the beginning of cozy looks . here's a look at the top fits from week 9 .

title: What to expect at the trade deadline for every team: Perfect fits, candidates to move, more
content: the 2025 trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET . we're previewing the deadline for all 32 teams . it's a short-term need that could be addressed for the 32 rosters . our NFL Nation reporters picked out one candidate to budge .

title: Indian-Origin Man In Canada Gets 25 Years Jail For 2022 Homicide Case
content: A Canadian court has sentenced an Indian-origin man to 25 years of imprisonment in a 2022 homicide case, local media reported.

title: Nearly 50 Dead After Hurricane Melissa Thrashes Caribbean
content: The deaths from Hurricane Melissa rose to nearly 50 people, officials said, after the ferocious storm devastated Caribbean islands and was bearing down on Bermuda.

title: Bengal Cops To Get AI Cell To Enhance Efficiency, Transparency
content: The Director General of Police of West Bengal, Rajeev Kumar, has issued an order to establish an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Cell in the police department with the aim of enhancing efficiency, transparency, and service quality.

title: Dump Garbage On Bengaluru Streets, Civic Body Will Toss It Back To You
content: Bengaluru residents who litter the streets have received a warning. If you throw trash on the street, the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) will toss it back to your house.

title: Global Race For Rare Earths Comes To Kenya's Mrima Hill
content: Division and suspicion have gripped five villages near Kenya's coast as global powers from the United States to China eye a forest that is rich in rare earths -- minerals vital to high-tech and low-carbon industries.

title: Mohammad Azharuddin Sworn Into Telangana Cabinet Amid BJP Criticism
content: Former Indian cricket captain and senior Congress leader Mohammad Azharuddin has been sworn in as a minister in the Telangana cabinet. Governor Jishnu Dev Verma administered the oath to the former cricketer at Raj Bhavan this morning.

title: India, US Sign Landmark 10-Year Defence Framework In Malaysia
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth exchanged an agreement on the framework for the US-India Major Defence Partnership, marking a significant milestone in strengthening bilateral defence cooperation between two nations

title: Fraud Suspect Escapes Custody, Cop Allegedly Took Bribe To Help Him
content: Hyderabad City Police Commissioner VC Sajjanar has suspended Task Force Sub-Inspector Srikanth Goud over a massive security breach that allowed a high-profile financial fraud accused, Vuppalapaty Satish, to escape custody.

title: NDTV Journalist Chased, Her Car's Windscreen Broken By 2 Men On Scooty In Noida
content: A senior producer working with NDTV 24x7 was chased by two men early Friday on her way home from her office in Sector-129, Noida.

title: President Droupadi Murmu, Others Pay Tribute To Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel On 150th Jayanti
content: President Droupadi Murmu offered a floral tribute at the statue of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel on the occasion of Rashtriya Ekta Diwas, celebrated in honour of his 150th birth anniversary.

title: Global Proxy War: Which Foreign Powers Are Backing Sudan's Warring Generals
content: The Sudanese army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF), vying for power in Sudan since April 2023, have been trading accusations of receiving support from foreign powers.

title: As Guns Fall Silent, Gazans Find No Cash In Newly-Opened Banks
content: The ceasefire in Gaza has eased the trauma of Israel's air strikes and blockade but a shortage of cash has left Palestinians unable to spend what little money they have without falling victim to wartime profiteers.

title: Russia Using Missile In Ukraine Over Which US Ended Arms Pact In 2019
content: Russia has in recent months attacked Ukraine with a cruise missile whose secret development prompted Donald Trump to abandon a nuclear arms control pact with Moscow in his first term as US president, Ukraine's foreign minister said.

title: Haryana University Women Staff Forced To Take Photos Of Pad To Prove Period
content: Protests broke out at Maharshi Dayanand University in Rohtak after a few women sanitation workers were allegedly forced by their supervisors to undress themselves and get their sanitary napkins photographed to prove that they were menstruating.

title: Bangladeshi National In India Jailed For 8 Years In Rape Case
content: A sessions court in Maharashtra's Thane district has sentenced a Bangladeshi national to eight years in prison after holding him guilty in a rape case.

title: Chief Secretaries Must Appear Physically In Stray Dogs Case: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has rejected requests by top bureaucrats seeking to appear virtually in the stray dogs matter for the second day in a row.

title: Death Penalty For 5 For Murdering Chittoor Mayor, Husband In 2015
content: Katari Anuradha and her husband, Katari Mohan, were murdered inside the Chittoor Municipal Corporation office in November 2015.

title: 25 Years Of Chhattisgarh: PM Modi To Inaugurate Rs 324 Crore Assembly Building
content: The state-of-the-art structure is considered one of the most technologically advanced legislative assemblies in India, featuring a blend of traditional Chhattisgarhi aesthetics and modern architecture.

title: Women Drinking Alcohol Is Harming Society: Bengal Cop Sparks Controversy
content: A video of a West Bengal police officer making controversial remarks about women's behaviour has gone viral on social media, triggering widespread criticism.

title: Trump Urges Senate To Scrap 60-Vote Rule As Shutdown Drags On
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday called for the "Nuclear Option" of scrapping the key 60-vote threshold required for the Senate to advance legislation, as Republicans face mounting pressure to end the US federal shutdown.

title: 🎃 LeBron announces Halloween children's book
content: "Happy Spooky Halloween" is a 32-page picture book with illustrations by Ariel Landy . the book is set to release on July 21 by publisher HarperCollins . "you guys know how much I love Halloween and this one's going to be special," James says .
